alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 22 at 5:30PM EDT until April 22 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Lehigh County in eastern Pennsylvania... Eastern Carbon County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 530 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Stoddartsville to Zionsville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Allentown, Easton, Mount Pocono, Bethlehem, Forks, Emmaus, Northampton, East Stroudsburg, Tobyhanna, Wilson, Hellertown, Nazareth, Palmerton, Bangor, Slatington, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Bath, Walnutport and Belfast. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 46 and 56, and between mile markers 81 and 94. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 55 and 69. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 282 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey near mile marker 0. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 13. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
